attributes.action: Compel Assessor to record PIP assessments to ensure honesty accuracy & fairness.
attributes.additional_details:
The current conditions  for the recording PIP Assessments are preposterous only allowing for the use of cassette/CD recorders that are no longer available. 

A claimant would have to provide 2 copies of a cassette tape.

This is totally unacceptable.  

Digital equipment is inexpensive and widely available but not permitted only Cassette or CD.  

In one case when a claimant asked an assessor where they could get hold of a double cassette recorder the assessor said, 'try and buy it on eBay'.
attributes.background:
Benefit assessors have been purportedly lying to the DWP regarding claimants health and disability.

Disabled people want to record their PIP assessments but are only permitted to use archaic & obsolete cassette equipment.
